Hello Craig, please close and open the application and it will start to work correctly again. We're hard at work solving this problem and we will release an update really soon.

title: Very Poor App
comment: I am using this app as i purchased bt with fon. I connect using the app and then lock and unlock ny phone, the app does not auto login and then this causes problems, which means i have shut down the app and disconnect from the hotspot and then reconnect. Also the connection drops out with this app all the time which is annoying.

title: Still causing wifi drops
comment: The feb 9th version still drops off wifi. Restarting the app doesn't help.

title: Causes wifi connectivity problems
comment: This app constantly causes the wifi connection to drop, whether its a FON network or not. My phone would only stay connected to a wifi network for 1-2 minutes before disconnecting, and would sometimes not reconnect. After uninstalling this app, my wifi works fine.

title: Leaves a lot to be desired
comment: It won't auto login when I manually join a fon spot. The map is useless when you don't want to incur in roaming fees. More functionality could be provided in the app.

title: Keeps disconnecting wifi on sleep
comment: The app caused wifi to constantly disconnect on sleep and doesn't reconnect on wake resulting in me burning  through my 3G data.  I've uninstalled the app.

title: Way to buggy and it's lacking features.
comment: When I click on an ap on the map, most of the times it won't go back to full map view or it will jump back at my location. Annoying as hell. Also, there isn't an option to configure my 2405a anywhere... Since you disable this feature from the web site, you must do something about it.

title: Broken update
comment: Spontaneously disconnects from known wifi points as reported by other users.

Hello Andrew, we've identified the problem and we're already working on it. For now, please close and open the application and it will start connecting to networks correctly. Sorry for the inconvenience!

title: Broken by latest update
comment: Used to work fine, now disconnects continually from all known access points.

title: it's now enormous!
comment: v3.0.7 5Nov2013 At 8.59MB it's now over 7 times biggr than the previous v2.2.1 & 27000 times smallest v1.4.7! I'm not impressed. And it's now hideously slow. I would only want the extra features in an app I can exit, not one that starts at boot. I also don't like that the login credential is now my email, not my username. I have backed up versions of com.Oakley.fon down to 189KB & a com.Sputnik.wispr at 32KB. I don't see why my apps have to keep growing - my phone isn't!

title: Doesn't work as it should
comment: I have an access to a whole Fon network thanks to service provider called Netia (Poland). If I enter my credential information using a website, everything is fine and internet connection is active. But when I use this application (all settings like username password and provider are correct - I checked them double) it shows information "Login failed". Please fix it, because now is completely useless. Fix: I've just found out that you have to add #netia after your e-mail address.

title: Incompatibility
comment: I used this app all the time because the FON service comes along with the cable service that I'm currently PAYING for. I had to format the SD card where I kept this app and when I got here to re-install it I get a warning saying "This app is incompatible with your phone". The version I used was working just fine and now I can't access it and I'm not "allowed" to install the most recent version. So now I pay every month for a service that I can't use because my phone magically isn't good enough anymore. Why do you fool around with your clients? Do I have to buy a 399€ phone just to be able to download your app?

title: Improved but...
comment: There's still some issues which were already mentioned. It doesn't connect automatically always, sometimes it connects to the network but doesn't authenticate, and drops often. Other then that, it's a really handy app when it works. Keep up the good work.  *Update* - Also, would be really great if, instead of just listing all the AP's with the same SSID, to select which BSSID I want to connect.  For example, I live in a area where I have 15 hotspots with the same SSID, my android connects "randomly" without necessarily using the one with best signal. It would be great to see which AP's exist under the same SSID and select the one with best signal.  I know there are apps for that (wifi analyzer for example), but this feature could be built-in in this app :)

title: problems in Japan
comment: in Japan there is another WiFi network also called "FON" and they use the SSID "FON" that this app tries to connect to and makes it quite useless here. If there was a way to specify the keyword to "FON_" then the problem would be solved and this would be a great app. Additionally it should also have a function to prioritize my private WiFi over the public at home.

comment: Mice
Works perfectly

title: Great idea but badly written (failing frequently)
comment: After any unexpected situation (eg. the hot spot temporary not reacting, service temporary not available, etc.), the app will get stuck and doesn't function anymore, until you kill the Fon task and restart it, or you reboot your phone. Also: after the app got stuck, even manual logons may fail afterwards, so it may even block your FON hotspots connections! Sometimes nothing will help anymore to get connected to a FON hotspot (even not killing the app *nor* rebooting your phone) until you delete your cookies!  Still a very nice idea, but redesign and rewriting the app required before its really usefull for me. Uninstalled, because it caused more problems then it helped me...  Could possibly be usefull for people with always-working-FON-spots around them, which - at this moment - seems to be a contradictio in terminis for Belgacom FON-spots ;(  Nb.   Same type of problems experienced with the Belgacom version of this app (available separately at Play Store, but which just looks to be a "rebranded" version of same app).

comment: It works, always! Simple and effective app!
